Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.components

Class RealGame

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.components.Game
it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.components.RealGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class RealGame
extends Game
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
This class creates and manages REAL_GAME phase layout. In this class the layout in which players start the match is defined. During real game phase, if a player is the current turn player he would see one of his worker selected, the border of the cell is in yellow and he can also select the other worker by clicking on it.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • RealGame

      public RealGame()
      This is the creator of the class. At the moment of creation gui attribute takes a reference to the static attribute Gui. At the moment of creation a controller is associated to the class.

  • Method Details

    • setLastCommand

      public void setLastCommand​(CommandType lastCommand)
      This public method is a simple setter of the CommandType attribute of the class lastCommand in which the last command, after clicking on a button
      Parameters:
      lastCommand - contains the type of the last command generated.

    • getSelectedWorker

      public JCellButton getSelectedWorker()
      This method is a simple getter of the selectedWorkerButton, attribute of the class.
      Returns:
      a reference to a button whose cell referred contains the selected worker.

    • getSelectedCellButton

      public JCellButton getSelectedCellButton()
      This method is a simple getter of the selectedCellButton, attribute of the class.
      Returns:
      a reference to a button whose cell referred is the cell in which a player wants his worker to move or build in.

    • setBoard

      public void setBoard​(java.lang.String board)
      This method is a setter of the class. It handles the remove of the content of the component and handles the draw on it.
      Overrides:
      setBoard in class Game
      Parameters:
      board - is a String JSon-format which contains information about all the cell involved in the match board.

    • changeTurn

      public void changeTurn()
      This method handles the real game component when turn changes. When a turn changes, the cell of the worker1 of the current turn player, is yellow-colored.
      Overrides:
      changeTurn in class Game

    • draw

      void draw()
      This method manages the title, the subtitle and buttons of the real game component. Every time a turn changes the component is emptied and re-drew. During real game phase a right panel is enabled and players will see buttons for their Gods commands.
      Specified by:
      draw in class Game

    • highlightWorkerFirst

      private void highlightWorkerFirst()
      This private method handles the highlight of the cell in which workerFirst of the current turn player is in.

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      This method manages the activities on the cells of the board. When the current player wants to change the worker through which he plays the command, he just have to click on the worker he wants and its border cell will be yellow-colored. Once decided the worker, player can select another cell whose border will be blue-colored and it indicates the cell in which the command will take place.
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
      Parameters:
      e - contains a reference to the JCellbutton clicked

    • reinitialization

      private void reinitialization()
      This private method is used when the turn changes. In this case, a cell containing the workerFirst of the current player will be yellow-colored and the player can start his turn.

    • onMove

      public void onMove()
      This method handles borders of the cell in which a player move into. When a player move from a cell to an adjacent one, the border of the latter one will be yellow-colored and the former one lose his original border color.

    • onBuild

      public void onBuild()
      This method handles borders of the cell in which the builder worker of the current player is in. Once the worker builds a level, border of its relative cell still remain yellow-colored.

    • disableButtons

      public void disableButtons()
      This method is simply used to disable the buttons that are on the real game component
